title: The Best Ways to Clean Your Yeezy Slides at Home

steps.title: Remove any loose dirt or debris with a soft-bristled brush.
steps.content: Remove any loose dirt or debris with a soft-bristled brush . Use a cleaning brush or a soft-bristled toothbrush so you don’t risk damaging your shoes. Gently scrub the surfaces and between the treads on the bottoms of your Yeezy slides to break apart any dirt or debris that’s stuck. [1] X Research source Avoid using stiff-bristled brushes or abrasive cleaners on your Yeezys because they could leave scratches in the material.

steps.title: Wipe surface marks with water, dish soap, and a microfiber cloth.
steps.content: Wipe surface marks with water, dish soap, and a microfiber cloth. Wet the corner of a microfiber cleaning cloth with warm water and add a drop of dish soap. Then, just use a circular motion to gently scrub any marks or stuck-on dirt off of your Yeezys. [2] X Research source Avoid applying excessive pressure when you’re cleaning your Yeezys, or it could damage the material. Even though a magic cleaning eraser can remove spots and marks, avoid using one because it may leave small scratches on the smooth surfaces of your Yeezys.

steps.title: Scrub stubborn stains with soapy water and a soft cleaning brush.
steps.content: Scrub stubborn stains with soapy water and a soft cleaning brush. Fill a bowl or plastic container with warm water and add in a few squirts of dish soap. Place your Yeezy slides in the soapy water and let them sit for about 30 seconds. Then, use your soft cleaning brush to gently work the stains off of the surface. Clean the bottoms of your Yeezy slides by working the bristles between the treads to get rid of dirt or mud stains. [3] X Research source Alternatively, you may try using shoe cleaner instead of dish soap. Avoid putting your Yeezy slides in the washer because the cycle could cause your shoes to get damaged or misshapen. Steer clear of using any harsh chemical cleaners on your Yeezys because they could get discolored.

steps.title: Rinse your slides with clean water.
steps.content: Rinse your slides with clean water. Hold your shoes under warm running water to get rid of any soap residue that’s still left on your shoes. If you notice any areas that still look dirty, scrub them a little bit more before rinsing them off again. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Pat your shoes dry with a clean towel and let them air-dry.
steps.content: Pat your shoes dry with a clean towel and let them air-dry. Set your Yeezy slides on a soft, clean towel and pat them dry. Be sure to wipe up as much water as you can, especially between the treads on the bottoms of the shoes. After you dry them off, lean your Yeezys against a wall to let them air-dry. [5] X Research source Leaning your Yeezys helps any excess water run off instead of leaving water marks on the material.

steps.title: Neutralize odors with a vinegar solution or baking soda.
steps.content: Neutralize odors with a vinegar solution or baking soda. Make a solution that’s half warm water and half distilled white vinegar. Wet a corner of a cloth with the solution and wipe it onto your Yeezys to get rid of the odor. Then, let your shoes air-dry. Alternatively, sprinkle a thin layer of baking soda on the footbeds and let it sit overnight to absorb the odor. The following day, just shake the baking soda out and wipe your slides with a clean cloth. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Wipe your slides with a damp cloth after each time you wear them.
steps.content: Wipe your slides with a damp cloth after each time you wear them. Whenever you finish wearing your slides for the day, check if they’re dirty or have any marks on them. Wet a soft microfiber cloth and quickly wipe up any dirt or debris you see so it’s less likely to leave a stain. [7] X Research source If you only wear your slides indoors, you may not have to clean them as frequently.

steps.title: Store your slides in a cool, dry place when you’re not wearing them.
steps.content: Store your slides in a cool, dry place when you’re not wearing them. Keep your Yeezys away from extreme temperatures or harsh conditions because excessive heat and cold could warp the materials. Find a place out of direct sunlight to keep your shoes, like in a closet or mudroom. [8] X Research source Put your slides back in their original box to keep them protected.

steps.title: Avoid wearing your slides on dirty or rough surfaces.
steps.content: Avoid wearing your slides on dirty or rough surfaces. If you know you’re going to a place with muddy or rough walkways, avoid wearing your slides so they don’t get messy or damaged. Try to only wear your slides when you’re walking on smooth, clean surfaces. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Apply waterproof spray to prevent stains and water damage.
steps.content: Apply waterproof spray to prevent stains and water damage. Waterproofing spray adds a protective layer onto the surface of your shoe that makes water and dirt slide off. Apply the waterproofing by spraying it directly onto your Yeezys, and then wipe up the excess with a clean cloth. Let your shoes dry completely overnight for the waterproofing to take effect. [10] X Research source Reapply waterproof spray after every few times you wear your slides, or as often as the packaging recommends. Additionally, you may apply sole protectors , which are adhesive covers that stick to the bottoms of your Yeezy slides. Just avoid using any sole protectors that require a heat gun to apply since it could warp or damage the material.
